intro: Hieracium angulare, commonly known as the angular hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium angulare is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
